explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 6degC (c.c.) and the boiling point is 60degC (ICSC (2003)), which is classified into Category 2. Classified as Class 3 and Packing Group II (UN#1150: 1,2-dichloroethylene) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: No data available, though containing unsaturated bonds. Classified as Class 3 (UN#1150: 1,2-dichloroethylene) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 460degC (1,2-dichloroethylene (ICSC, 2003)).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not oxygen and fluorine), with the chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN#1150: 1,2-dichloroethylene) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hour-inhalation of vapour) value of 13,700ppm (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)) was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (264,000ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 26.7kPa (25degC), the substance was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data, though human epidemiological studies provide evidence of "irritation of the eye and skin following application of aqueous solutions" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data, though human epidemiological studies provide evidence of "irritation of the eye and skin following application of aqueous solutions" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No data available

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, and positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (chromosome aberration tests), described in NTP TR55 (2002), ATSDR (1996) and CERI Hazard Data 2000-46 (2001).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category D by EPA (1995).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies "In the 8,000ppm dose group, narcotic effects and some death were observed at 4 hours. In the 16,000ppm dose group, narcotic effects occurred within 8 minutes; deaths were observed at 4 hours" (PATTY (4th, 2000)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "decreased hematocrit levels/RBC" (ATSDR (1996)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 96 hours LC50=135mg/L of the fish (Bluegill) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was not water-insolubility (the water-solubility =6410mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified.
